page.title: 12BOATS AT WELLS SAILING CLUB
page.content: The International 12 Square Metre Sharpie came to England in 1932. Designed by Kroger and Brauer in 1931 it was the winning design in the competition organised by the Deutscher Segler Verband, the German Sailing Club, to find a two man centre board dinghy of high performance. The desing has proved to be amazingly robust - many top class boats are over 40 years old and yet still able to compete on even terms with newer boats. The class was in its heyday in 1965, when it was the two man dinghy at the Melbourne Olympics. Jaspser Blackall, K63 - Chuckles, won the silver medal for Britain. In the past 15 years interest has revived and there are now 50 boats racing in the U.K with the largest fleet at Wells-next-the-sea.
